Question
========

Suppose the probability distribution of X = the number of jobs per student at a university in the past year is as follows:_____________. \

  ------------------ ------ ------ ------ ------ ------ Number of jobs *X* 0 1 2 3 4 Odds 0.14 0.37 0.29 0.15 0.05 ------------------ ------ ------ ------ ------ ------

\ \

What then is the probability that, choosing a random student, this student had two or fewer jobs during the past year, such as P(X â‰¤ 2)?

* 0,14
* 0,29
* 0,37
* 0,80

Solution
========

Answerlist

* 0.29: Incorrect
* 0.37: Incorrect
* 0.80: Correct
